<summary>
    • The invention relates to a combustion apparatus designed for efficient, clean burning with modular heat utilizing appliances.
        • The burner features a combustion chamber with secondary and tertiary combustion air flow, an external shroud for safety, and a cool surface.
            • It includes removable components like an ash pan and a grill for various appliances.
            • The burner can be coupled to different heat utilizing appliances, such as cookers and a pyrolyzer.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention aims to improve ignition and cooling systems in rotary internal combustion engines to enhance combustion efficiency and reduce structural failure risks.
  * * The housing structure is designed to facilitate circumferential cooling flow and minimize thermal distortion around spark plug bosses.
    * * The housing structure incorporates staggered spark plug bosses, offset from a centerline, to promote a controlled flow regime and increase the heat transfer coefficient at the spark plug boss zone.
    * * Flow diverters or flow controllers are used between the spark plug bosses to ensure a controlled flow regime and strengthen the housing structure.
* The invention also provides a housing structure for a rotary internal combustion engine with a peripheral cooling circuit that allows separate paths for vapor release from spark plug bosses.
  * * The cooling circuit is defined to improve coolant performance around the circumference of each spark plug boss and reduce local thermal conditions.
    * * The staggered arrangement of the spark plug bosses allows for a high heat transfer coefficient at the sensitive spark plug boss surfaces.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method of minimizing flow disturbance in turbines during periodic operational testing of control valves.
    * It utilizes control valve positions as feedback to maintain constant total mass flow through parallel turbine inlet flow control valves.
    * This method ensures the steam generator pressure remains constant and the inlet pressure regulator is unaffected during testing.
    * The flow characteristic for each valve of the system with N valves and with N-1 valves is determined during the turbine design process.
    * The invention includes a test compensation circuit that adjusts the flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closure and reopening of a turbine control valve during testing.
* The invention has been mathematically modeled, thermodynamically accurate, and simulated in real time, demonstrating a reduction in pressure excursion by 95% when using the flow compensation of the present invention.
    * The control system of the invention contains algorithms for compensation of flow during valve testing, and the use of this system reduced pressure excursion significantly.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a mixing valve for combining fluids from two separate sources into one mixture, specifically for an aircraft cleaning apparatus.
    * The valve allows for a proportional mixture ranging from 0% of inlet A fluid to 100% of inlet B fluid.
    * It is adjustable to provide a continuous analog control of the mixture.
    * The valve comprises a valve body with two inlet passages and one outlet passage.
    * A valve means within the body directs the two fluids toward the outlet passage.
* The valve body is made of a material like 304 S/S and includes a flow restricting device for each inlet.
    * The flow restricting device reduces the flow rate of the respective fluid entering the valve.
    * The valve body also includes an outlet passage for connecting to a cleaning solution pipe.
* The valve body contains a series of cylindrical spools and channels for retaining fluid seal rings.
    * The spools and channels are slidably received within the valve body.
    * The fluid seal rings retain soap solution and water in their respective vicinities within the valve body.
* The valve system allows for continuous analog control of the mixture proportions.
    * The system maintains constant fluid pressures at the inlet passages.
    * The maximum flow rate through the spools occurs only when the bores are axially aligned with their respective communication passages.
* The invention contemplates the use of a check ball valve to prevent backflow into the soap solution source.
    * A similar mechanism may be installed within the water inlet passage to prevent backflow into the soap solution source.
* The valve system can operate multiple identical valve systems from a common source without affecting fluid pressures.
    * The flow rate of fluid through the spools is diminished as the bores are moved away from axial alignment with their respective passages.
* The valve system is suitable for stand-alone cleaning tasks with complete control over the cleaning solution strength.
    * It is particularly useful in the commercial airline industry for extensive aircraft cleaning tasks.
* The valve system is designed to prevent contamination of the soap solution source by water

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and arrangement for compressing and cooling gas in a compressor station for gas pipelines, particularly in permanent frost areas, to reduce investment and operation risks.
    • The method involves compressing gas to an excess pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and expanding it to the desired exit pressure.
    • The arrangement includes at least one compressor, heat exchanger, valve-controlled pipelines, and control units.
    • An electronic control system operates the compressor to achieve excess pressure and expands the gas to the desired pressure.
    • The invention utilizes the cooling effect of gas expansion to reduce the need for separate re-cooling plants, especially during warm periods.
    • The method allows for the recovery of mechanical energy during gas expansion, which can be used to drive the compressors.
    • The invention features a three-stage compression process with parallel operation of compressors in different seasons, reducing the need for standby machines and increasing plant availability.
    • The invention provides significant cost and safety advantages over conventional re-cooling methods, with a potential reduction in investment by 40 to 45%.
    • The invention can be adapted to various configurations and is not limited to the embodiments shown in the drawings.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention addresses the need for improved kinematic mounts (KM) for spacecraft instruments, which are prone to high vibration levels during flight.
  * * The invention introduces damping features into KMs to reduce vibration and protect instruments.
    * * Damping materials are incorporated into the mounts at specific locations to dissipate vibration energy as heat.
    * * The damping mechanism is designed to be frequency and temperature dependent, providing negligible stiffness at low frequencies where thermal loads occur.
  * * The invention simplifies the manufacturing process by using six identical strut elements, reducing complexity and costs.
    * * The strut design can be made from titanium alloy, and the mounting scheme can be arranged to uncouple suspension vibration modes.
    * * The invention can be applied to a wide range of precision instruments where alignment stability is crucial.
* The invention aims to meet two major requirements for space-based applications:
  * * * The mounting system must not adversely affect the instrument's stability.
    * * * It must provide strong support and minimize loads transmitted to the instrument during launch.
* The invention modifies conventional KM designs by introducing vibration damping materials.
  * * * The damping materials are placed at machined hinge or flexure locations in the mounts.
    * * * The damping mechanism is designed to be frequency and temperature dependent.
  * * * The invention uses titanium alloy or non-metallic materials for the damping mechanisms.
* The invention offers significant performance improvements over existing designs.
  * * * The invention can achieve modal damping values from 5-17% of critical damping.
    * * * This is at least one to two orders of magnitude greater damping than existing designs.
    * * * The invention reduces the flight-induced random vibration response of the instrument by approximately one third.
* The invention can be applied to a wide range of precision instruments.
  * * * The invention can be used for instruments with alignment stability requirements.
    * * * The invention can be used for instruments with rotating parts that induce lateral im

<summary>
* The invention relates to large size oil shear type clutch units, particularly for aircraft catapult systems, with interleaved clutch plates and discs.
    * It addresses the need for high coupling forces, cooling, and minimized residual drag in large power transmission applications.
    * The clutch unit features hydraulic fluid for both retracting the plates to reduce drag and as a coolant for the discs.
    * It allows for easy replacement of clutch disc segments without complete disassembly.
* The clutch unit comprises an input shaft, output shaft, clutch plates, clutch discs, and separate means for closing the gap between plates and discs, including piston and cylinder means connected to the plates and fluid pressure control means.
    * The auxiliary fluid pressure control means urges the clutch plates to retract and acts as a coolant.
* The clutch discs are segmented and interleaved, with removable fastener means for easy segment replacement.
    * The design minimizes residual drag and allows for improved torque control and cooling.
* The invention provides a new clutch unit with improved cooling, reduced drag, and convenient inspection and maintenance of clutch disc segments.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an internal combustion engine system that incorporates downstream expansion cylinders associated with a combustion cylinder to significantly lower the temperature of fluids, potentially eliminating the need for a radiator.
    * The system includes a water injection system that cools the exhaust gases and steam expansion, with the recovered water being reused for expansion.
    * A gearing system optimizes the output of the combined engine, allowing the two cylinders to drive the crankshaft in a non-one-to-one fashion.
* The invention also features a catalytic material placed on surfaces that will "see" the hot exhaust gases, enabling catalytic conversion of impurities within the engine itself.
    * The system is designed to maximize thermal-to-mechanical energy extraction, with the potential to achieve steady-state thermal-to-mechanical efficiencies in the range of 94-96%.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method for fabricating steel plates with a precoat that prevents the formation of detrimental intermetallic areas during welding and heat treatment, enhancing mechanical strength and corrosion resistance.
    * The precoat consists of an intermetallic alloy layer on the steel substrate, topped by a metal alloy layer.
    * A portion of the metal alloy layer is removed from the precoat's periphery to eliminate the source of intermetallic areas during welding.
    * The width of the removed area is adjusted to prevent alloying with the steel substrate during heat treatment and to ensure corrosion resistance.
    * The steel composition is controlled to achieve desired mechanical properties, with a focus on martensitic or bainitic-martensitic microstructures.
    * The invention includes methods for removing the metal alloy layer using brushing or laser ablation, followed by welding, heat treatment, and deformation to produce parts with good ductility and corrosion resistance.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention is a novel SCADA system for remotely controlling mobile structures that recover energy from severe weather patterns.
        • It optimizes energy extraction by using an algorithm that accounts for weather observations and sensor data.
            • The system includes computer servers that gather data from various sources, including GPS, weather satellites, and NOAA's GIS.
            • The SCADA system allows for remote human interaction with mission-critical navigation plans through a GUI.
            • The system is not limited to the Turbine-Integrated Hydrofoil system and can control any mobile structure exploiting energy from weather patterns.
    • The system comprises communication satellites, GPS, and wireless communication for data transfer.
        • Data from various sources, including weather satellites and NOAA's GIS, are aggregated by the central service facility.
            • The system uses TCP/IP for data transmission between servers, workstations, and microprocessor systems.
            • Redundant servers and communication links ensure data reliability and system robustness.
    • The system includes a microprocessor-based control system with various sensors and actuators for navigation and energy extraction.
        • Control algorithms use CFD calculations and VPPs to estimate energy efficiency and suggest optimal points of sail.
            • The system can adjust turbine gate openings, rudder rotation, and sail trim to optimize energy recovery.
            • The system can also adjust ballast draft and propeller speed for propelled mobile structures.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage manufactured using a ring element composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined in the circumferential direction and connected via welding.
  * The flat material ring segments are formed as 120° ring segments, requiring only three weld points for joining.
  * The ring segments can be punched out from a sheet metal strip in succession, with circular arc-like edges and joint geometries cut out in one step.
* The invention aims to reduce production costs by minimizing waste material during manufacturing.
  * The process involves welding flat material ring segments in an engagement zone, forming undercut geometry for initial coupling, and subsequent plastic forming for axial securing.
  * The method allows for high-quality weld connections with minimal distortion and material usage.
* The invention is suitable for both radial and axial bearing cages, with the possibility of using a single ring element for symmetrical designs.
  * Laser welding is preferred for forming weld points, with the option of pressure welding for local material accumulation.
* The process can be adapted to various bearing types, including groove and angular ball bearings, with the potential for additional wire ring elements to enhance mechanical strength.
  * The method includes steps for punching, welding, and contouring, with the possibility of pre-joining ring segments before welding.
* The invention provides a high-quality design for weld connection points, with material beads generated during punching to ensure complete weld seam filling.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to methods and systems for improving telecommunications customer service by accurately determining and transmitting customer service locations using global satellite positioning.
    * A technician input device collects coordinates at a service location, which are then used to update databases and provide precise directions for service technicians.
    * A mapping system generates travel directions between service locations, enhancing response times and reducing errors in locating customers.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, particularly magnetic fields, using two sensors and a digital processor.
    * The system employs real triaxial magnetic field sensors and three pairs of compensation coils, with the control unit processing the sensor signals and generating control signals for the coils.
    * The control algorithm can be linear or nonlinear, and the system can simulate the measurement of electromagnetic interfering fields at the object's location.
* The invention also addresses the issue of feedback effects when two compensation systems are used in close proximity, using a feedback matrix to mitigate undesired interactions.
    * The system can be optimized for different types of interference, and the control signals can be adjusted for various applications without the need for physical repositioning of the sensors.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method for investigating biological samples using CARS microscopy, where a resonance signal is sensed in image-producing fashion.
    • CARS microscopy involves using two lasers to generate a CARS spectrum, which is amplified when the frequency difference matches molecular vibration states in the sample.
    • The invention aims to improve CARS microscopy by introducing at least one resonance site via a bioorthogonal reaction.
    • Bioorthogonal reactions are chemical reactions that proceed in living systems without interfering with natural processes.
    • The invention allows for the tagging of samples, including biological tissues, with resonance sites for enhanced CARS microscopy imaging.
    • The method includes a two-step process: equipping the sample with a bioorthogonal functional group and introducing a tagging substance with a complementary functional group.
    • The invention enables the creation of a stable, reproducible background signal for improved image analysis.
    • The invention can be used for tagging and imaging structures not naturally detectable by CARS microscopy.
    • The invention is particularly suitable for tagging in biological samples, such as nerve tissue, and for applications like purity checking in food chemistry.
    • The invention allows for the introduction of small molecules deep into tissues without steric hindrance.
    • The invention combines the advantages of CARS microscopy with bioorthogonal reactions for selective reaction and image production.
    • The invention improves the specificity and scattering cross section of CARS microscopy.
    • The invention can be used with fixed-wavelength Stokes light beams for image production.
    • The invention includes a schematic illustration of a CARS microscope and a flow chart of the method.
    • The invention is based on known bioorthogonal reactions, such as copper-free click chemistry and Staudinger ligation.
    • The invention allows for the selective enhancement of desired structures in a sample, improving the reproducibility of CARS methods.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a system for assessing radiation therapy segmentations.
    • It compares segmentations from various sources, including manual and software-generated segmentations.
    • The comparison process uses electronic files in DICOM-RT Structure Set format.
• The system generates volume models from segmentation files and identifies common, missing, and extra volume elements.
    • It measures the conformance between volume models using a metric method.
    • The metric method can be customized and includes constant, linear, and exponential functions.
• The system provides a graphical display to assist in evaluating segmentation quality.
    • It uses color-coding to differentiate between common, missing, and extra volume elements.
• The system allows for customization of the metric method and can display histograms for error trends.
    • It can be used for training, evaluation, and product assessment purposes.
• The system can be used for periodic quality assurance of autosegmentation routines.
    • It can assess segmentation quality before and after changes in patient anatomy.
    • It is intended to be adaptable and include modifications within the scope of the claims.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to data processing systems and provides an improved apparatus for executing floating point operations.
	• It aims to accelerate the effective subtraction operation in a floating point unit.
	• The technique uses a difference between a subset of signals of the operand exponent arguments to speed up the operation.
	• The subset difference allows for an initial subtraction of differences between operand fractions before the complete difference between the exponent arguments is determined.
• The invention divides the effective subtraction operation into two procedures based on the absolute value of the difference in exponent arguments.
	• When the absolute difference is less than or equal to one, the operation can be simplified by aligning fractions without a separate step.
	• When the absolute difference is greater than one, the operation ensures a positive resultant quantity without the need for negation.
• The invention reduces the number of steps in the effective subtraction operation by using a subset difference.
	• The subset difference enables the calculation of the final fraction result during the time it takes to determine the complete difference between the exponent arguments.
	• This results in a reduction of the major steps from seven to five, accelerating the overall computation.
• The invention employs a technique to calculate a difference between the seven least significant bit signals of the operand exponent arguments.
	• This technique determines the correct final fraction result based on the subset difference, reducing the need for additional calculations.
	• The final fraction result is either FRACTION A, FRACTION B, or a combination of both, depending on the subset difference value.
• The invention's apparatus includes a subtraction unit, detection logic unit, and selection logic unit.
	• These units work together to determine the correct operand fractions and perform the necessary subtraction to obtain the final fraction result.
	• The apparatus can perform the operation with the subset difference available before the complete difference is determined, further accelerating the computation.
• The invention's preferred embodiment calculates the subset difference and uses it to initiate the correct subtraction procedure.
	• This ensures that the final fraction result is at least in progress when the complete difference is available, speeding up the overall computation.
	• The invention's scope is limited only by the claims and can include variations that achieve the

<summary>
    • The invention relates to a method and system for tracking and collecting patient specimens in a medical facility, reducing mislabeling and errors.
        • The method involves storing machine-readable codes on patient ID, orders, specimen-takers, and specimen containers in computer storage.
            • A processor determines if the patient's ID and order barcodes match, storing related codes in relational manner and generating a signal to collect the specimen.
            • The system includes a computer storage, an electronic reading means, and a processor that relates barcode codes to patient information and specimen collection.
            • The invention eliminates the need for vial labels and associated staff labor, reducing costs and errors.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to semiconductor design technology, specifically systems and techniques for implementing circuit designs into silicon-based integrated circuits (ICs).
    * It addresses the challenges of verifying integrated circuit designs that include both memory and logic components, which have different sizing, performance, and scaling issues.
    * The invention provides a design rule checking system that applies appropriate rules to the correct regions of mask pattern data, using customized rules for different types of memory regions.
        * Customized rules are created by modifying standard logic rules to accommodate the more liberal values available for memory regions.
        * The system can be implemented on conventional computing systems and is adaptable to various computer languages.
        * The invention categorizes design rule check results by region type, such as Logic, BDSP SRAM, BLSP SRAM, DP SRAM, and ROM, improving error detection and classification.
* The invention eliminates false errors caused by applying logic rules to memory regions and helps pinpoint real design rule errors in mask pattern data.
        * It ensures that all memory regions fulfill memory rules, which are generally more lenient than logic rules.
        * The invention is applicable to any mask pattern database and can be adapted to various industries requiring different design rule applications.
* The invention is intended to be broadly applicable, with potential benefits extending beyond the semiconductor industry to other fields requiring micro-patterned technologies.
        * The scope of the invention includes any alterations and modifications that adhere to the teachings of the invention.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to waveguide holograms for controlled illumination of objects with specific requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators.
  • Waveguide holograms (WGHs) are thin substrate waveguides that allow for uniform illumination and high diffraction efficiencies.
  • WGHs can be used to replace bulky conventional illumination systems, offering compact and rugged arrangements.
  • The active volume of a WGH illuminator is significantly smaller than that of conventional lens systems, leading to a substantial gain in space efficiency.
  • WGHs provide high diffraction efficiencies and do not allow undiffracted light to enter the observer's eye, making them ideal for display holograms.
  • Challenges with WGHs include alignment sensitivity, nonuniformity of the diffracted wavefront, and the potential for light dispersion.
  • Solutions to these challenges involve careful design, alignment techniques, and the use of specific recording systems.
  • The invention has been experimentally validated using various light sources and objects, demonstrating its versatility and effectiveness.
  • The invention is not limited to the specific examples provided and can be adapted to other light sources and objects with inventive skill.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to non-destructive testing of dynamoelectric machine rotors, specifically squirrel cage rotors in induction motors, to measure resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew for identifying defects.
    • The invention provides a method and apparatus that is economical, reliable, and non-destructive, avoiding the need for expensive or destructive testing methods.
    • The apparatus includes a test head that magnetizes the rotor and senses voltage and current signals, as well as skew signals, during angular movement.
    • The processing means determines the rotor's resistance, reactance, and effective skew from the signals, with automatic pass/fail determinations.
    • The apparatus can be integrated with a data acquisition, processing, and control system for automated testing and data analysis.
    • The system allows for efficient testing by reducing operator setup time and can handle multiple rotors simultaneously.
    • The apparatus includes a detailed statistical analysis capability for quality control over numerous tests.
    • The invention is adaptable, with variations and modifications falling within its scope.
</summary>

<summary>
* The disclosure provides methods for securing mobile devices by managing access to native resources through digital certificates and managed libraries.
    * It includes granting access to native resources to managed libraries after validating their digital certificates.
    * It denies access to native resources to managed applications that lack a digital certificate authorizing specific resource access.
* The disclosure also outlines a process for third-party application development and execution on closed mobile devices.
    * It involves a manager verifying third-party code at runtime and granting access to specific native resources through managed libraries.
    * The manager is effectuated by native instructions and can deny access to unapproved resources.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an improved identification card featuring an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip.
  * The card includes two protective, non-rigid layers onto which artwork can be printed, followed by rigid outer layers.
    * The internal components are protected from damage by the flexible nature of the non-rigid layers.
    * The card structure differs from prior art by using rigid materials throughout, providing structural support and protection.
* The core layer comprises a silica-filled polyolefin with a first and second side.
    * The first side has an antenna and integrated circuit chip attached, with an anti-binding agent printed on the opposite side.
    * The core layer is bonded to a bottom sheet of silica-filled polyolefin using a co-polyester based adhesive.
* Two layers of substantially transparent polymer are affixed to the bonded core layer/bottom layer structure.
    * The polymer layers provide mechanical strength and protect the printed images.
    * The thickness of the polymer layers is preferably at least 0.1 mm, with a range of 0.125 to 0.225 mm.
* The image-receiving layer may be formed by dye diffusion thermal transfer printing or inkjet printing.
    * The layer can include security features like low cohesivity polymeric layer, optically variable ink, or UV/IR readable ink.
    * The protective layer prevents dye bleeding and offers additional security against tampering.
* The card can be personalized using an inkjet printer before adding the polymer layers.
    * Personalized information is printed between the core layer and the polymer layers.
    * The protective layer is still applied to ensure durability and security.
* The card can be manufactured using a Tetrahedron press and nip-roll lamination process.
    * The process involves bonding the core layer/bottom layer with an adhesive, followed by lamination with transparent polymer layers.
    * The card can be further personalized and secured with additional coatings like UV sensitive inks.
* The invention provides significant improvements in durability and ease of manufacture compared to prior art cards.
    * The flexible non-rigid layers protect

<summary>
* The invention relates to an improved implementation of a FIFO queue in memory, specifically for functional memories using a tree-shaped structure.
    * The tree-shaped structure, or "tree," has nodes with a maximum size and maintains a balance condition where all leaf nodes are at the same level and internal nodes are full except for those on the edges.
    * Additions and deletions in the tree are managed efficiently, with leaf nodes always at the same hierarchy level and updates requiring logarithmic time and space.
    * A header node is used to optimize updates, allowing for faster and less memory-intensive operations, and the tree can be inverted quickly and with minimal space.
* The invention also includes a preferred embodiment with a header node that simplifies additions and deletions, and a bit in the header node indicating the queue's direction, enabling quick inversion and double-ended queue functionality.
    * The memory arrangement includes control logic for managing the queue, with input and output registers for record pointers and a flag register for the inversion bit.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to EPROM devices that can be manufactured using existing DRAM technologies, offering a cost-effective solution for embedding redundancy circuits in DRAM devices.
        • Utilizes DRAM storage capacitors as coupling capacitors in EPROM devices, significantly increasing the gate coupling ratio and reducing operation voltages.
        • Enables the use of EPROM devices for programmable redundancy circuits in DRAMs, which can be reprogrammed multiple times using electrical procedures, reducing testing costs.
    • Provides EPROM devices using standard logic technologies without the need for high voltages, simplifying manufacturing processes.
        • Introduces stress effect programmable read-only memory (SEPROM) devices that use transistor damages from electrical stresses to store data, ideal for embedded applications and security purposes.
        • SEPROM devices can be manufactured by any IC technologies and are capable of storing large amounts of data at a low cost, with undetectable data storage methods.
        • While SEPROM devices cannot be reprogrammed multiple times due to accumulative stress damage, data can be refreshed by rewriting the same data periodically.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a method for determining optimal feedback gains in control systems, facilitating quick and accurate adjustments.
  * * The method involves iterative steps of provisionally setting feedback gains, executing control, evaluating performance, and adjusting gains based on evaluation.
    * * Evaluation functions are introduced for assessing the influence of P, I, and D gains on control stability, accuracy, and response.
      * * The method can determine optimum P, I, and D gains independently, without complex multi-variable analytic processes.
      * * The invention is applicable to various feedback gains and control systems, with flexibility in the order of determining gain optimality and the choice of evaluation functions.
</summary>

<summary>
* Field of the Invention: Zoom lenses with increased relative aperture and minimized size for cameras.
  * Description of Related Art: Demand for zoom lenses balancing aperture range and size reduction.
    * Video cameras require high relative aperture due to low image pickup sensitivity.
    * Reduction in image pickup tube size while maintaining image quality.
* Summary of the Invention: A zoom lens with small F-number, high zoom ratio, and standard image angle.
  * Conditions for construction:
    * R.sub.4,2 /F.sub.4 < 0.85
    * f.sub.5,2 /F.sub.5 < 1.5
    * f.sub.5,4 /f.sub.5,5 < 1.5
    * (ν.sub.5,1 + ν.sub.5,6)/2 < 59
    * 0.75 < |F.sub.2 /Fw| < 0.85
* Detailed Description:
  * Zoom lens comprises five lens units with specific refractive powers and curvatures.
    * First lens unit: Positive power, axially movable for focusing.
    * Second lens unit: Negative power, axially movable for varying magnification.
    * Third lens unit: Negative power, compensates for image plane shift.
    * Fourth lens unit: Positive power, makes diverging light beam almost parallel.
    * Fifth lens unit: Six lenses with alternating powers, image forming function.
* Technical Significance:
  * Conditions ensure good aberration correction throughout zooming range.
    * Strong rear curvature in fourth lens unit reduces spherical aberration and coma.
    * Refractive power ratios in fifth lens unit correct spherical aberration and astigmatism.
    * Abbe number range in fifth lens unit balances chromatic aberrations.
* Examples:
  * Numerical examples demonstrate construction of zoom lenses meeting conditions.
    * Example 1: Focal lengths, radii, and Abbe

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, and photons, in a detector.
  * The method and device allow for both the detection of individual particles and the integration of signals, particularly at high count rates, without prior knowledge of expected signal rates.
  * The invention aims to improve the detection and evaluation of small-size signals by performing discharges on the low-voltage side of the detector, thus simplifying the distinction from background noise.
  * A first, fast amplifier amplifies individual signals, while a second, slow amplifier integrates signals upon exceeding a threshold rate.
  * The invention proposes the use of materials like diamond for fast charge transport and detector material doped with converter material for detecting uncharged particles.
  * The device can be used in particle accelerators, reactors, diagnostic devices, and medical technology, among other applications.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies in clutches.
    • The apparatus includes an enclosure with stationary and movable rings for mounting the disc assembly.
    • A torque motor and servo motor are used to apply and control torque, respectively.
    • An electronic sensor measures the distance between rings, and the difference in this distance after applying torque indicates the amount of warpage.
    • The apparatus operates automatically without manual intervention and provides external indications of test results.
    • The invention minimizes operator error and allows for easy storage of measurements for process control.
    • The apparatus can be practiced in ways not specifically illustrated without departing from its spirit or scope.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to methods, systems, and software for face age-estimation, incorporating government-supported research.
* It addresses the challenges of accurately estimating human face age due to various controllable and uncontrollable factors.
* The invention utilizes a contourlet appearance model (CAM) for robust feature extraction from facial images.
* Two aging functions are constructed to represent different aging periods, such as early childhood and adulthood.
* An age classifier distinguishes between different age groups using Support Vector Machines (SVMs).
* The system can estimate age from a first image by comparing it with a database of second image data with known ages and landmark points.
* The system can be implemented on various computing devices and includes user interfaces for interaction.
* The invention can be used in applications like surveillance, age-restricted business access, and criminal identification.
* The invention includes a training method for creating aging functions and an age classifier.
* The system can provide age estimates with confidence factors.
* The invention can be implemented on a computing system with various components, including a processor, memory, storage device, and input/output devices.
* The system can be integrated with networks for broader application.
* The invention is adaptable and can be combined with other features for new embodiments.
* The detailed description includes diagrams and examples illustrating the invention's implementation.
* The invention's scope is not limited to the claims, description, or abstract provided in the document.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, preserving the definition of the higher-definition image.
  * The device comprises a controller for producing display light intensity signals for each pixel and a matrix of pixels organized in identical arrangements.
    * Each arrangement can consist of a square of four pixels, with specific pixels dedicated to displaying each image.
    * Pixels dedicated to the first image can emit a single color, while those for the second image emit a different color.
    * The controller can apply attenuation functions to the light intensity signals based on predetermined threshold values.
* The device can include two controllers, one for each image, interfacing with the respective pixels.
    * The controllers can generate video streams with different definitions and refresh frequencies, optimizing overall consumption.
    * The device can display a plurality of combined images, with arrangements dedicated to different images.
      * For example, it can combine images from a night vision sensor, an infrared sensor, and a microcontroller or microcomputer, each with different resolutions and colors.
      * The device can use pixel arrangements to display the first image on the majority of the matrix, with the second and third images displayed on specific pixels, using complementary colors to enhance resolution and visibility.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention introduces a mobile identification transmitter for motor vehicle security systems that allows keyless activation and payment functionalities.
    * The transmitter includes a removable payment element that can communicate with electronic payment systems for cashless transactions.
    * The transmitter can be in a normal state, allowing communication with both the security system and the payment system, or in a secure state, where the payment element is removed and the housing is sealed to prevent unauthorized payment actions.
    * The transmitter can be designed with a closure that protects the housing in the secure state and can be moved between active and passive positions.
    * The transmitter can include an energy storage device for powering the electronics and payment element, with a second redundant device for reliability.
    * The communication between the payment element and the payment system can be cryptographically secure and operate via Bluetooth or near field communication.
* The invention also allows for the payment element to be integrated into a carrier that matches the housing receptacle's geometry, providing a secure yet accessible payment component.
    * The invention ensures that the communication means of the payment element can be used for both security system activation and payment system communication.
    * The invention provides for a compact design with a movable closure that seals the housing when the payment element is removed, offering both security and convenience.
</summary>

<summary>
* The disclosed embodiments address issues related to the tribo charge of toner in imaging devices, such as printers and copiers, which can decrease during periods of inactivity, affecting image quality.
    * An intelligent method for controlling the tribo charge of toner is proposed, which includes determining periods of inactivity, measuring toner charge levels, and adjusting the toner charge based on these measurements.
        * The method uses a power law to approximate the decay of tribo charge during inactivity and includes a user usage pattern determining section that adapts to user behavior.
        * A charging section adjusts the toner charge based on the calculated decay, and a performing section pre-runs the machine to ensure adequate charge levels for printing.
        * The method can be implemented in software or hardware, and variations or improvements can be made by those skilled in the art.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a high-precision control apparatus for plural magneto resistive (MR) heads in recording/reproducing devices, particularly rotary magnetic head type apparatuses.
    • It enables independent and precise regulation of bias currents for each MR head mounted on a rotary drum.
    • The apparatus uses a single control channel for control signals, allowing for high precision and scalability.
    • The control signals can include data for regenerative amplifier switching and recording current settings.
    • The invention also allows for the prioritization of control data for head switching, preventing signal loss or incorrect settings.
    • It can be applied to both digital and frequency-modulated analog signals, and is not limited to MR heads.
    • The invention can be effectively applied to both rotary and disk apparatuses, and can accommodate various integrated circuit configurations.
    • The invention facilitates early finalization of head switching and bias current setting, ensuring stable data recording and reproduction.
    • It can be adapted to various embodiments, with the possibility of using digital or analog signals, and can be applied to apparatuses with multiple head types.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to enable hands-free automatic answering and communication.
        • It includes a selector switch for switching between conventional and automatic answering modes.
        • A timer controls the duration of automatic answering, which can be bypassed for extended conversations.
        • The system is designed to be portable, modular, and cost-effective, with minimal components for safety and reliability.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to optical fiber communications, focusing on system network design and incorporating branch powered amplification.
    • It aims to reduce or eliminate undersea optical repeaters by using remotely pumped optical amplifiers powered by branch cables.
    • The system includes a trunk and branch ring network with hubs and cable stations for signal routing and amplification.
    • Optical energy is transmitted unidirectionally over branch cables to power amplifiers, eliminating the need for additional fiber runs.
    • The invention supports ring topology for network survivability, isolating single trunk cuts or branch cuts without compromising overall network integrity.
    • It accommodates reconfigurable wavelength add/drop branching units and respects undersea sovereignty concerns.
    • The technology reduces capital, operating, and maintenance costs by minimizing the number of required repeaters.
    • The invention is applicable to both undersea and terrestrial communications systems, with adaptability to various signal multiplexing methods.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices.
    * The device comprises two parts: an attachment member and a cover plate member.
        * The attachment member is installed over a wiring device and mounted using screws.
            * It contains latching pawls on its transverse ends and a central tab used as a fulcrum.
            * The cover plate member has saw-tooth shaped racks to engage the latching pawls and a slot for a small tool to pry off the cover plate.
            * The cover plate member has apertures to receive wiring device projections and a ridge to accommodate variations in wall flatness.
    * The invention aims to provide a cover plate device with no visible fasteners when installed.
        * It is designed to be easily installed or removed using simple tools and available fasteners.
            * The device can be properly positioned over wiring devices installed in non-flat or uneven walls.
            * The independent operation of the pawls and racks allows the cover plate to follow the wall contour closely.
* The invention also includes various embodiments for different numbers of wiring devices.
    * For two wiring devices, the attachment plate and cover plate have specific configurations with two apertures, pawls, racks, and tabs.
        * For three wiring devices, the attachment plate and cover plate have configurations with three apertures, pawls, racks, and tabs.
        * For four wiring devices, the attachment plate and cover plate have configurations with four apertures, pawls, racks, and tabs.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to automated speech technologies that provide feedback to speakers when their rate of speech may be too fast for listeners to comprehend, particularly in non-native language contexts.
    * It involves a system that monitors and compares the speaker's rate of speech to a listener's comprehension threshold, which can be adjusted based on language proficiency and other factors.
    * The system can include wearable devices or integrated mechanisms that alert speakers to slow down or switch to an alternative language, enhancing communication clarity.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to multimedia communications, specifically handling multimedia calls with legacy phones and services.
    • It addresses the rapid evolution of telecommunications and consumer demand for multimedia services.
    • The invention proposes a solution for integrating multimedia capabilities with existing circuit-switched and packet-switched calls without replacing legacy equipment.
    • The technique involves a multimedia server and a telephony server working together, using software called a blender to manage blended calls.
    • The blender software initiates parallel voice and multimedia components, integrating signaling paths and controlling bearer paths for multimedia requests.
    • The invention is well-suited for use with SIP-T configuration and can be adapted to various network systems and protocols.
    • It allows for backwards compatibility with legacy equipment and services, avoiding the need for immediate replacement.
    • The invention can be implemented using software or embedded sequential logic, and it includes mechanisms to prevent infinite loops between the blender and telephony server.
    • The invention can also utilize Intelligent Network (IN) signals to determine if a blended call is being handled.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a content synchronization framework for connected devices, incorporating related applications filed concurrently.
* It addresses limitations of existing data synchronization methods, such as lack of support for arbitrary attributes, inefficient geographical data distribution, and unscalable server-centric architectures.
* The invention introduces a client-centric synchronization method that prioritizes file downloads based on dynamic attributes and context.
* The framework includes a central reference point that processes synchronization requests, compiles file bundles, and communicates with client devices.
* Client devices send synchronization requests with contextual information, which the central reference point uses to prioritize and download file bundles.
* The system supports data synchronization over various network topologies and optimizes communication with data compression.
* It allows resumption of synchronization from the last failed bundle, improving efficiency.
* The invention enables client devices to execute scripts or actions on downloaded bundles, such as decompressing or installing files.
* The framework is scalable, as it distributes work to client devices instead of centralizing it on a server.
* It supports multiple languages and character sets, and can be deployed worldwide.
* The invention includes a synchronization response that contains file bundles with properties and actions, and can be compressed for efficient transmission.
* The system can cache responses for similar requests, reducing server processing time and increasing scalability.
* The invention also includes an SDP application that facilitates the synchronization process, with an "updating" phase that adapts to downloaded files and their locations.
* The system allows for optimization of the downloading order based on communication speed and geographical proximity of download sites.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to methods and systems for facilitating anonymous communication between a finder and an owner of a lost or misplaced object.
    * An owner can register tags with unique IDs and virtual locales (e.g., website addresses) to their possessions.
    * The system allows the owner to update and manage contact information associated with their tags.
* The system provides a secure and anonymous communication channel for finders to contact the owner.
    * Finders can access a website associated with a tag ID to send messages or open new cases without revealing their identity.
    * The system automatically forwards messages and alerts to the owner's preferred communication methods.
* The invention includes a server that checks for incoming messages and alerts, and a database for storing associations between tags and owners.
    * The system supports multiple messaging protocols and can forward messages to various communication platforms.
    * The system includes a user registration process with security measures to prevent automated registrations.
* The invention can be implemented using programming languages like Perl, Apache web server, MySQL database, and open source modules like Net-Oscar for instant messaging.
    * The system is adaptable to different programming languages, operating systems, and database systems.
* The invention aims to provide a timely and efficient method for returning lost possessions to their owners while maintaining privacy and security.
    * The system can be used for a wide range of portable personal property.
    * The invention includes various embodiments and options for user interaction, allowing flexibility in implementation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to electron multipliers, particularly foil electron multipliers, used in various detectors and spectrometers.
* * The invention utilizes a series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure to multiply electrons through transmission stages.
* * A voltage is applied to each foil to accelerate electrons and generate secondary electrons, which continue to the next foil.
* * The invention can be used for amplification of incident electron flux or detection of particles like photons, ions, and electrons.
* * The foil electron multiplier has advantages over conventional multipliers, including higher gain per stage, simpler fabrication, lower cost, larger area coverage, and intrinsic rejection of ion feedback.
* * The foil electron multiplier design uses thin foils with a specific thickness and applied voltage to maximize gain and minimize ion feedback.
* * The invention demonstrates higher gain efficiency compared to conventional electron multipliers.
* * The invention is not limited to the precise form disclosed and can be modified or varied for different applications.
* * The embodiments were chosen to best explain the principles and practical application of the invention.
* * The invention is defined by the claims appended hereto.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system that allows viewers to experience 3-dimensional effects from 2-dimensional motion pictures without special equipment.
  * It utilizes the Pulfrich effect, where lateral motion in a movie appears 3D when viewed through glasses with controlled lens darkening.
  * The system includes glasses with individually controllable lenses, a digital sensor, and a processor to analyze the movie and control the lens states in real-time.
* The glasses can take three states: both lenses clear, right lens darkened, and left lens darkened.
  * The processor uses an intensity edge finding algorithm to detect lateral motion and determine the direction of movement.
* The system works with any 2D motion picture format, including digital, film, or broadcast media.
  * It allows older or pre-3D movies to be viewed with a 3D effect.
  * The viewer glasses are battery-powered and controlled by the processor, reducing eyestrain and discomfort.
  * The invention aims to overcome the production, projection, and viewing challenges of 3D motion pictures.
  * It offers advantages such as no need for special filming equipment, compatibility with various media formats, and the ability to view older movies in 3D.
  * The system can potentially be extended to other visual effects and algorithms for motion detection.
  * The invention includes technologies for changing color and transparency in lenses, digital photo sensors, and miniature computers.
  * The lens control algorithm can be adapted for different types of motion or visual effects in the movie.
* The invention provides a novel solution to the challenges of 3D motion pictures, offering a comfortable and versatile viewing experience.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a field emission display device with a protection structure to prevent damage to field emission components.
    * The protection structure includes at least one reduction plate or electrode on the cathode.
    * The reduction plate or electrode alters the discharge path of ionized gases, preventing electrical surges to the cathode.
* The reduction plate or electrode can be elongated and run parallel to rows of field emission elements.
    * Alternatively, the reduction plates can be arranged in a meshwork- or net-shaped configuration among the field emission elements.
* The invention aims to prolong the lifetime of the field emission elements by preventing burnout damage.
    * The reduction plates or electrodes are typically made of electrically-conductive metal and are separated from the cathode by an insulation layer.
* A bias voltage source is connected to the reduction plates to apply a negative voltage, attracting positive ions and preventing them from contacting the cathode.
* The manufacturing process involves depositing a metal layer on a substrate, patterning a mask to define the cathode strips and reduction plates, etching to form the cathode strips and field emission elements, and depositing materials for the light emission elements.
* The invention is not limited to the specific embodiments or sequences of steps described, and variations and modifications are possible.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to home networks with power management systems for devices.
    • Power management is needed due to high energy consumption of network appliances.
    • Current systems struggle to enter power save mode while performing network administrative functions.
• The invention proposes methods for transferring network administrative functions from master to slave devices to save power.
    • Methods include receiving instructions to enter power save mode and transferring data to a slave node.
    • Another method includes receiving a request to send data and sending a request reply for acceptance.
• The invention allows for the selection of the best qualified slave node to take over as master node.
    • Selection criteria include visibility, intelligence/functional capabilities, and user selection.
• The invention ensures network administration continues while minimizing power consumption.
    • Network administrative functions can be transferred while the slave node performs its own functions.
    • The invention also allows for self-promotion of a slave node to master node if the current master node fails.
• The invention includes a detailed description and flow diagrams for operation.
    • Devices in the network can perform nominal functions and network administrative functions.
    • The network can be implemented as a master/slave network with devices capable of serving as both master and slave nodes.
• The invention includes a brief description of the field of the invention and related art.
    • Power management is desirable for home networks, and current systems have limitations.
    • The invention aims to optimize network performance and administration while conserving power.
• The invention includes a detailed description of the embodiments and their operation.
    • The invention includes diagrams and flow charts to illustrate the network and operation.
    • The invention includes a discussion of the scope of the invention and its flexibility for modifications and variations.
</summary>
